body.directions: Listen to the audio, and then complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can best be completed with the word in the audio?
body.answer: 我的房子有 _____和窗。Wǒ de fángzi yǒu_____hé chuāng.
options: 她每天练习唱_____。Tā měitiān liànxí chàng _____.
他上午八_____到达学校。Tā shàngwǔ bā _____ dàodá xuéxiào.
我妹妹喜欢_____米饭。Wǒ mèimei xǐhuān _____ mǐfàn.
body.correct: You got it! 门 mén means “door.” This word can best complete the sentence 我的房子有门和窗。Wǒ de fángzi yǒu mén hé chuāng. (My house has doors and windows.)
body.incorrect: Not quite…Think about the meaning of 门 mén and what part of a house it indicates. Then place it in the sentences in the choices to see which one fits the best for both meaning and structure.

body.quiz: Which of the following least likely has the item indicated in the audio?
body.correct: You got it! 窗户 chuānghù means “window.” Of the rooms of a house shown in the choices车库 chēkù (garage) is least likely to have a window, compared to the other three.
body.incorrect: Oops…Listen to the audio again to identify what item it is. Then consider the different rooms of a house indicated in the choices to see which one is least likely to have this item.

body.quiz: Which of the following is the antonym (word with the opposite meaning) of the word in the audio?
body.correct: Beautifully done! The word 左边 zuǒbiān means “left side.” Its antonym (word with the opposite meaning) should be 右边 yòubiān (right side).
body.incorrect: Not quite…Listen to the word in the audio again to identify its meaning. Then consider what its opposite meaning should be, and compare it with the words in the choices.

body.quiz: Which of the following does not have the same final as the second character in the word presented?
body.answer: Audio for 院子 yuànzi
options: Audio for 冬天 dōngtiān
Audio for 电脑 diànnǎo
Audio for 文件夹 wénjiànjiā
body.correct: You got it! The second character, 边 biān, in the word 右边 yòubiān has the initial “ian.” Of the choices, only the word 院子 yuànzi (yard) doesn’t have the same final.
body.incorrect: Not quite…First identify the final of the second character in the word presented; then listen to the words in the choices to see which one doesn’t have the same initial.
